intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range from white to pale yellow, often with a distinctive central division. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine or rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
